definition: nail/to follow closely/to keep at sb (to do sth)/variant of 盯[ding1]
to join things together by fixing them in place at one or more points/to nail/to pin/to staple/to sew on

sentences.english: Think studs and a pearl necklace, if you must wear jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必須戴首飾，就考慮耳釘和珍珠項鍊。

sentences.english: The heart-shaped studs in clear crystal pavé will make your heart melt.
sentences.chinese: 心形透明密鑲水晶耳釘足以讓你心動。

sentences.english: I showed Jill the earring, and she admitted it was hers.
sentences.chinese: 我給Jill看了我發現的耳釘，她承認是她的。

sentences.english: Ellen’s ears glow with diamond earrings.
sentences.chinese: Ellen耳垂上的鑽石耳釘閃閃發光。
一條項鍊，一隻戒指，還有耳釘。

sentences.english: A gold-plated chain attaches them to two bezel-set clear crystal studs.
sentences.chinese: 鍍金色飾鏈銜接在包邊鑲嵌通明水晶耳釘上。

sentences.english: Selection of high quality earrings, on the Park Road Cikuan heart-shaped diamond highlights show.
sentences.chinese: 高品質的耳釘精選，就在樸道此款心形加亮水鑽呈現。

sentences.english: His trademark earrings were gone and so was the arrogant manner of the past.
sentences.chinese: 他標誌性的耳釘和之前的傲慢態度通通都不見了。

sentences.english: Pierce an earring on the webbed part between the thumb and the forefinger.
sentences.chinese: 在大拇指與食指中間像鴨蹼的地方穿孔戴上耳釘。

definition: derailment/to jump the track (of train)/to derail
weight/pendant/same as 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]/ballad singing accompanied by a 墜胡|坠胡[zhui4 hu2]
ring pull (can)/strap handle (on bus or train)/circular door handle
